derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English staca, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch staak, also to stick
late Middle English: perhaps a specialized usage of stake, from the notion of an object being placed as a wager on a post or stake

entry.tran: 处于危险境地;处于成败关头
entry.def: If something is at stake, it is being risked and might be lost or damaged if you are not successful.

example.ex: The tension was naturally high for a game with so much at stake...
example.tran: 对于一场成败攸关的比赛来说气氛自然非常紧张。

example.ex: At stake is the success or failure of world trade talks...
example.tran: 世界贸易谈判正处于成败的重要关头。

entry.def: The stakes involved in a contest or a risky action are the things that can be gained or lost.

example.ex: The game was usually played for high stakes between two large groups...
example.tran: 游戏通常在两大集团之间进行，下的赌注一般都很大。

example.ex: By arresting the organisation's two top leaders the government and the army have now raised the stakes...
example.tran: 逮捕了该组织的两名主要头目后，政府和军队现在面临的风险更大了。

entry.def: If you stake something such as your money or your reputation on the result of something, you risk your money or reputation on it.

example.ex: He has staked his political future on an election victory...
example.tran: 他把自己的政治前途押在竞选获胜上。

example.ex: He has staked his reputation on the outcome.
example.tran: 他将自己的名声赌在了这个结果上。

entry.tran: 利害关系;重大利益;(企业等中的)股本，股份
entry.def: If you have a stake in something such as a business, it matters to you, for example because you own part of it or because its success or failure will affect you.

example.ex: He was eager to return to a more entrepreneurial role in which he had a big financial stake in his own efforts...
example.tran: 他渴望回到一个更多参与创业的角色，那样他所付出的努力会与自己的经济利益息息相关。

example.ex: Detectives now believe the Mafia also had a stake in the plot and killed him when it went wrong.
example.tran: 侦探们现在相信黑手党在这个阴谋中也有利害关系，并在事败后杀了他。

entry.def: You can use stakes to refer to something that is like a contest. For example, you can refer to the choosing of a leader as the leadership stakes .

example.ex: Britain lags behind in the European childcare stakes.
example.tran: 英国在儿童保育方面落后于欧洲其他国家。

entry.def: A stake is a pointed wooden post which is pushed into the ground, for example in order to support a young tree.

entry.tran: 提出权利要求;主张权利
entry.def: If you stake a claim, you say that something is yours or that you have a right to it.

example.ex: Jane is determined to stake her claim as an actress...
example.tran: 简决心主张自己作为一名女演员的权利。

example.ex: Baguet's success staked his claim for a place in Belgium's world championship team.
example.tran: 巴古埃特的成功使他有资格成为比利时世界锦标赛参赛队伍中的一员。

means.word_mean: 1. (law) a right or legal share of something; a financial involvement with something;

sentences.sentence: "they have interests all over the world"

means.word_mean: 2. a pole or stake set up to mark something (as the start or end of a race track);

sentences.sentence: "a pair of posts marked the goal"
"the corner of the lot was indicated by a stake"

means.word_mean: 3. instrument of execution consisting of a vertical post that a victim is tied to for burning
4. the money risked on a gamble

sentences.sentence: "I will stake my good reputation for this"

means.word_mean: 4. tie or fasten to a stake;
5. kill by piercing with a spear or sharp pole;

sentences.sentence: "the enemies were impaled and left to die"

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)向某人敲诈、勒索钱财

example.en: The hooligan puts peddlers on the stake monthly.
example.zh: 那地头蛇按月向小贩们强索保护费。

auth_sentence.content: Everything is at stake when anything is at stake.
auth_sentence.res_content: Everything is at stake when anything is at stake.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everything is at stake when anything is at stake.

auth_sentence.res_content: Why are you buying a stake in Portsmouth FC?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why are you buying a stake in Portsmouth FC?

auth_sentence.content: We knew what was at stake, Subban said.
auth_sentence.res_content: We knew what was at stake, Subban said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We knew what was at stake, Subban said.

Sentence.sentence: In sum, we all have a common stake in our school, our community, and our society.
The second rule is don't raise the stakes by challenging her authority.
Another part of the study suggests far more is at stake than the mere expression of views.

sentences.cn: 他用木桩子撑住新栽的树。

means.word_mean: 以…下注[打赌]，（就某事）以…打赌，拿…冒险

sentences.en: I staked ten pence upon a horse, and it won.
sentences.cn: 我在一匹马身上押了十便士, 而它居然赢了。

jushi.english: The city engineer staked the new school site.
jushi.chinese: 城市设计工程师用木桩标出了新学校校址。
他用木桩子撑住新栽的树。

jushi.english: I have staked the apple trees in my garden.
jushi.chinese: 我已把花园里的苹果树都用木桩子支起来了。
